meanings.definition: A small pointed tool used for piercing holes in leather or wood.
meanings.sent1: The craftsman used an awl to make holes in the leather.
meanings.sent2: I need to buy a new awl for my leatherworking project.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat batted the awl off the table.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like an awl, piercing through his defenses.
meanings.sent5: The awl's sharp tip easily punctured the tough leather.

meanings.definition: To pierce or make a hole with an awl.
meanings.sent1: She carefully awled a hole in the leather strap.
meanings.sent2: I will awl the fabric to attach the button.
meanings.sent3: He awkwardly awled his finger instead of the wood.
meanings.sent4: The truth awled through his excuses like a hot knife through butter.
meanings.sent5: The determined carpenter awled through the thick wood effortlessly.
